channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 英放送規制当局OfcomがGB Newsに新たに4件の公平性調査を開始、2023年初めに2件の苦情を支持（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
UK broadcast regulator Ofcom launches four new impartiality investigations into GB News, after upholding two complaints earlier in 2023  —  Broadcaster faces four Ofcom investigations over impartiality.  —  GB News is facing four new impartiality investigations from broadcast regulator Ofcom.

item.title: 日刊紙「ベルリン・ツァイトゥング」を買収し、再建を主導して以来、論争に巻き込まれているドイツの大富豪ホルガー・フリードリッヒの横顔（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
A profile of German millionaire Holger Friedrich, who has been engulfed by controversies since acquiring and leading a turnaround of the daily Berliner Zeitung  —  East German entrepreneur has been engulfed by a string of controversies since buying historic Berliner Zeitung

item.title: コムスコア：『バービー』が全世界興行収入10億ドルを突破、公開からわずか17日で、女性単独監督映画として初の10億ドル突破（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Comscore: Barbie crosses $1B+ in worldwide box office sales, just 17 days after release, the first movie solely directed by a woman to cross the $1B threshold  —  “Barbie” has earned more than $1 billion in worldwide box office sales, according to Comscore.

item.title: 情報源：NYTは2023年初め、ジェーン・アラフ・バグダッド支局長を休職処分にした。
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: the NYT placed Baghdad bureau chief Jane Arraf on leave earlier in 2023 during a probe into her possible misuse of funds, like overpaying non-US staff  —  The Scoop  —  The New York Times fired its second Baghdad bureau chief in five years in a bizarre saga that has infuriated some of the paper's staff in the Middle East.

item.title: 情報筋Paramountは早ければ8月7日にもSimon & SchusterをPE会社KKRに売却することで合意したと発表する予定。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Paramount plans to announce an agreement to sell Simon & Schuster to PE firm KKR as soon as August 7; the deal would value Simon & Schuster at ~$1.62B  —  The deal with KKR, a private equity firm, is said to be valued at roughly $1.62 billion, and could be announced as soon as Monday.

item.title: ジェネレーティブAIの助けを借りて編集され、欺瞞的なレビューによって宣伝されていると思われる、粗悪な自費出版ガイドブックがアマゾンで急増している（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Shoddy self-published guidebooks, which appear to be compiled with the help of generative AI and promoted via deceptive reviews, are proliferating on Amazon  —  In March, as she planned for an upcoming trip to France, Amy Kolsky, an experienced international traveler who lives in Bucks County …

item.title: CWエンターテインメント社長ブラッド・シュワルツとのQ&A：全番組の権利を所有することの重要性、スポーツへの迅速な進出、オリジナル番組の制作などについて（Lesley Goldberg/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Lesley Goldberg / The Hollywood Reporter:
Q&A with The CW Entertainment President Brad Schwartz on the importance of owning all show rights, quickly expanding into sports, producing originals, and more  —  Brad Schwartz joins the 'TV's Top 5' podcast to discuss why big studio shows like ‘Riverdale’ won't work as the network shifts its focus to becoming broader (and older).

item.title: 放送局が脚本番組を少なくする中、そうしたコンテンツを必要とするストリーミング・サービスは、より多くのエピソードを持つシリーズを作ることで、解約やカタログ危機を避けることができる（Josef Adalian/Vulture）
item.description:
Josef Adalian / Vulture:
As broadcasters make fewer scripted shows, streaming services that need such content can avoid churn and a catalog crisis by making series with more episodes  —  This story first ran in Buffering, Vulture's newsletter about the streaming industry.  Head to vulture.com/buffering and subscribe today!

item.title: ダンジョンズ＆ドラゴンズの出版社ウィザーズ・オブ・ザ・コーストは、近日発売予定のソースブックにAIアートの痕跡があることをファンが発見したことを受け、AIによる生成的なイラストの禁止を計画している（Thomas Wilde/GeekWire）。
item.description:
Thomas Wilde / GeekWire:
Dungeons & Dragons publisher Wizards of the Coast plans to ban generative AI-made illustrations, after fans spotted signs of AI art in an upcoming sourcebook  —  BOT or NOT?  This special series explores the evolving relationship between humans and machines, examining the ways that robots …

item.title: イーロン・マスクは、「このプラットフォームに何かを投稿したり、いいね！を押したりしたことが原因で」雇用主から「不当な扱いを受けた」人々の弁護士費用をXが負担すると主張している（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
Elon Musk claims X will fund the legal bills of people who have been “unfairly treated” by their employer “due to posting or liking something on this platform”  —  Elon Musk has said his X social media platform will fund the legal bills of people who have been treated unfairly …

item.title: MrBeastのようなクリエイターは、動画のサムネイルに最高1万ドルを支払う（Nilesh Christopher/Rest of World）。
item.description:
Nilesh Christopher / Rest of World:
Some designers say AI tools have made them anxious about the YouTube thumbnail microeconomy's future; creators like MrBeast pay up to $10K for a video thumbnail  —  Creators like MrBeast pay up to $10,000 for a single YouTube video thumbnail, but the rise of AI tools have some designers anxious about the microeconomy's future.

item.title: ロシアのニュースを扱うMeduzaによると、Apple Podcastsは同社の主要ポッドキャストを削除し、2日後に理由も示さずに番組を復活させたという（Meduza.io）。
item.description:
Meduza.io:
Meduza, an outlet covering Russian news, says Apple Podcasts removed its flagship podcast and then restored the show two days later without providing reasons  —  Meduza has received a notice from Apple, informing our media that our flagship podcast “What Happened” has been removed from the Apple Podcasts streaming platform.

item.title: 調査米国のハイテク企業家ネビル・ロイ・シンガムは、世界的に左翼団体に資金を提供し、プロパガンダを広めるために中国政府メディアと密接に協力している（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Investigation: US tech entrepreneur Neville Roy Singham, who funds left-wing outlets globally, works closely with Chinese government media to spread propaganda  —  The Times unraveled a financial network that stretches from Chicago to Shanghai and uses American nonprofits to push Chinese talking points worldwide.

item.title: メモ：WGAは、8月4日のAMPTPとの会合後も、両者の隔たりが大きすぎるとし、AMPTPが自らのメディアブラックアウト要請に違反したと非難した（The Wrap紙）
item.description:
The Wrap:
Memo: the WGA says the two sides remain too far apart after the August 4 meeting with the AMPTP, accusing the AMPTP of violating its own media blackout request  —  In a letter to members, WGA accuses studios of leaking details about ‘confidential’ meet-up  —  Hopes for renewed contract talks between …

item.title: バンクーバーを拠点とするIndigiNewsとオンタリオ州を拠点とするThe Sarnia Journalのジャーナリストは、メタのニュースブロックが彼らのサイトの訪問者を減らし、アウトレットに打撃を与えていると述べている（Khadijah Khogeer/NBC News）。
item.description:
Khadijah Khogeer / NBC News:
Journalists at Vancouver-based IndigiNews and Ontario-based The Sarnia Journal say Meta's news block is reducing their sites' visitors and hurting their outlets  —  Meta recently began blocking news from Instagram and Facebook in Canada in response to the Online News Act.
